content: आक्षिप् {c6c} <ab>U.</ab> {@--1@} To throw or cast down, dash down; फलं तरंगाक्षिप्तं <ls>Pt. 4</ls>; शिलायामाक्षिप्य <ls>Pt. 1.</ls> {@--2@} To attract, entice, allure, win over; यथा नाक्षिप्यसे विषयैः <ls>K. 109</ls>; <ls>Śi. 10. 79.</ls> {@--3@} To strike with a dart, missile &c. {@--4@} To draw near or together, contract, convulse (used in medicine). {@--5@} To interrupt, cut short; एवंवादिनो वचनमाक्षिप्य <ls>K. 18</ls>, <ls n="K.">207</ls>; <ls>Ve. 6.</ls> {@--6@} To draw back or withdraw; take or throw off, snatch or draw away, pull off; अग्रपादमाक्षिप्य <ls>R. 7. 7</ls>; <ls>Ku. 7. 58</ls>; वासो बलादाक्षिपन् <ls>Bh. 1. 43</ls>; <ls>Me. 68.</ls> {@--7@} To chase, drive out of a place, remove; स एतानाक्षिपद्राष्ट्रात् <ls>Mb.</ls>; आक्षिप्ताधिकारयोः <ls>Mu. 1.</ls> {@--8@} To hang out, expose to view (as a banner). {@--9@} To point to, refer to, hint at, indicate; वस्तुतस्तु नेह पूर्वपदमाक्षिप्यते <ls>P. VI. 3. 34</ls> <ls>Sk.</ls>; अश्वादय आक्षिप्यंते <ls>S. D. 2.</ls> {@--10@} To reject, neglect, disregard, spurn; <ls>Amaru. 79.</ls> {@--11@} To object to (as argument). {@--12@} To insult; अरेरे राधागर्भभारभूत किमेवमाक्षिपसि <ls>Ve. 3</ls>; to blame; <ls>Śānti. 1. 18.</ls> {@--13@} To eclipse, obscure; आक्षिपंतीमिव प्रभां शशिनः स्वेन तेजसा <ls>Mb.</ls> {@--14@} To infer (from circumstances); जात्या व्यक्तिराक्षिप्यते <ls>K. P. 2.</ls> {@--15@} To say or state ironically. {@--16@} To pass (as time); <ls>Śi. 14. 45.</ls>
